title: Hey Riot, when you give Mordekaiser the rework he deserves
body:
Drop the duo lane Juggernaut shtick.

Don't go all like; Mordekaiser is a duo laner now so we'll rework him once more to fit this fantasy.
No no, learn from this whole fiasco and actually try to give us a soul enslaving dark lord character and not another guinea pig.

Thanks.

Sure, but Graves was still given a bunch of things he may not necessarily have had if CertainlyT wasn't in charge of it. Overall, the Graves redesign is fine and evokes the idea of a shotgun-toting badass but a few things stand out as being added for the sake of it. For instance, why does Q have to have a return blast of damage? Q detonating instantly when it impacts a wall is neat, but it's already proved an issue and was given a delay in the latest update so maybe it didn't need to be part of his budget. Plus, the self-knockback for his Ult, while thematic to the idea of the skill, is something else Riot has to consider when looking at his power level.

This is the sort of thing we talk about when CertainlyT overloads a kit. He'll toss in a bunch of seemingly innocuous things that build upon each other to create something stronger than it first appears on paper. Then the balance team has to deal with the relative nightmare that is balancing these champions without changing their kits too much in the process.

Anyone who thinks Yasuo has "limitless" mobility is a fool. That mobility has an absurd amount of limits: Requires a target, can't be used on the same target again for at least 6 seconds, has a fixed distance and direction, and can be interrupted by any hard CC. The fact that it can only be used on an enemy is already an enormous limiter on his mobility. Compare that to Riven who can use her dashes in any direction at any time if you want a real champion with anywhere near "limitless" mobility. Yasuo's mobility is as "limitless" as Kalista's is.

Morde was riot's failed attempt at making a kit shaped by the meta, which is a distasteful choice as the meta should arise naturally from the mechanics of the game itself (not the other way around).

however, having a kit that is benefitted from other champions being around is not a bad thing, I really like how morde W is now. However, things like gaining max exp regardless if an ally is around or not is just seeping power from his non-duo ability without being a very engaging or interesting mechanic.

Yeah, it's hard to make a kit defined by low range, 0 CC, and 0 mobility work without being defined by *some* element of teamplay since that's just about the only reliable element you can add. You can kind of see that's what CertainlyT was going for, but it was way out of line with Morde players' expectations.

I think a game where Morde ends up as a farm dependent duo laner because universally available systems enable melees to survive a traditional ADC + Support lane is pretty interesting. A game where Morde is a farm dependent duo laner because his kit has passives saying "Morde is a farm dependent duo laner, unlike all the other melee champs" is not. It feels forced and it limits future design space in that area.

They did something similar re: "Marksmen in the Jungle" with Kindred, but since Kindred were a new champ and there wasn't as much of a demand for variety in the jungle nobody really raised a fuss. The patience system could have led to some Marksmen becoming viable as junglers organically, but Kindred's release totally overshadowed a few off-meta builds (why use Twitch jungle when you can just play Kindred?). Graves/Quinn reworks just compounded this.

I'm probably overexaggerating, but it's fun to dream of what could have been...

I don't disagree with you there, he's in a wonderful spot right now. The sustained damage, build-up-to-massive-damage approach is the best for Mordekaiser, and much easier to balance around, in my opinion.

Riot wants to keep his duo-lane identity in tact, but the meta just doesn't allow two melee characters in the bot lane, especially when the carry has no form of cc or mobility (or even slows).

Almost every adc played right now has a slow or dash/jump/displacement. Mordekaiser has none of that, which makes him super heavily reliant on his support, as well as making him vulnerable to ganks.

In top lane, that doesn't matter as much since your opponent will also have to get close to deal damage. But bot lane requires more range in order to survive, farm, poke, and trade effectively.

Just my thoughts here.
